The gestation period for an elephant is approximately 22 months, meaning that a pregnancy beginning in 2020 would end in 2022. Next, let's consider the solar eclipses. Solar eclipses occur when the Moon passes between the Sun and Earth and blocks the sun's rays. They happen when the Moon is in its new moon phase, which occurs about every 29.5 days. 

In 2020, there were two solar eclipses - one on June 21 and one on December 14. In 2021, there will also be two solar eclipses - one on June 10 and one on December 4. 

However, the occurrence of solar eclipses has no impact on the length of an elephant's pregnancy. Whether there are 4 solar eclipses or zero solar eclipses in a particular year has no bearing on how long an elephant's pregnancy will last. Therefore, we can confidently answer that the 2020 elephant pregnancy will not last past next year with 4 solar eclipses, and the correct answer is (B) no.
